Legal_Issue: Breach of procedural fairness by relying on undisclosed extrinsic evidence
Governing_Law: Principles of procedural fairness in administrative decision-making
Application_Facts: Applicants claimed lack of access to medical and social services in Mexico; officer conducted independent internet search to challenge this without disclosure
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the immigration decision
Court_Ruling: Judicial review granted; decision remitted for re-examination by a different officer
Claimant_Status: Applicants seeking humanitarian and compassionate (H&C) grounds exemption
Defendant_Behavior: Immigration officer used undisclosed online research to assess country conditions
Grounds_for_Claim: Unfair reliance on non-disclosed evidence affecting H&C assessment
Legal_Standard: Procedural fairness requires disclosure of significant, novel information to applicants
Assessment_Factor: Reasonableness, transparency, and evidentiary basis of the decision
Procedural_Issue: Failure to disclose extrinsic evidence prior to decision
Credibility_Assessment: Applicants' claims undermined by undisclosed evidence
Evidence_Used: Internet-sourced information about services in Mexico
Application_Basis: Humanitarian and Compassionate (H&C) grounds for exemption
Evidence_Assessed: Contradictory evidence from internet search not shared with applicants
Relief_Sought: Overturn of decision and re-evaluation by a new officer
Governing_Rule: Decision-makers must disclose significant external information to allow response
Harm_Assessment: Applicants denied opportunity to respond to adverse evidence
Cause_Description: Challenged denial of H&C exemption due to procedural unfairness
Evidence_Handling: Improper: relied on non-disclosed internet research
Legal_Provision_Violated: Implied breach of procedural fairness under administrative law principles
Evidence_Assessment: Officerâ€™s use of internet evidence without verification or disclosure
Decision_Rationale: Decision lacked transparency and fairness due to non-disclosure
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to disclose and verify external evidence
